alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 9:29PM EDT until April 09 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following county...Somerset. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 PM EDT, flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen this evening. This is on top of what fell earlier today. - For Lamington River at Burnt Mills: At 8:45pm the stage was 10.1 feet. Flood Stage is 11 feet. ... For West Branch Middle Brook at Martinsville: At 9:15pm the stage was 5.13 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. ... For North Branch Raritan River at North Branch: At 9:15pm the stage was 11.58 feet. Flood Stage is 12.3 feet. ... For North Branch Raritan River at Raritan: At 9:15pm the stage was 8.2 feet. Flood Stage is 10 feet. ... For North Branch Raritan River at South Branch: At 9:00pm the stage was 8.21 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 28 and 35. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 25. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
